events.title: Pilgrims Land at Plymouth Rock
events.description: English Pilgrims aboard the Mayflower land at Plymouth Rock, establishing one of the earliest successful English settlements in North America.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of permanent European settlement in New England and played a key role in American colonial history.

events.title: Thomas Edison Demonstrates the Phonograph
events.description: Thomas Edison publicly demonstrates the phonograph for the first time, showcasing his invention that could record and reproduce sound.
events.significance: The phonograph revolutionized the music industry and laid the foundation for modern sound recording technology.

events.title: First Automatic Landing of a Commercial Jet
events.description: The Boeing 737, operated by United Airlines, makes the first automatic landing of a commercial jet during a test flight in Denver.
events.significance: This milestone represented significant progress in aviation technology, enhancing flight safety and precision.

events.title: The Dayton Agreement Initialed
events.description: The leaders of Bosnia, Croatia, and Serbia initial the Dayton Agreement, an accord intended to end the Bosnian War.
events.significance: This agreement laid the foundation for peace in the Balkans after years of conflict and ethnic violence.

events.title: The Last Old Manila Railway Steam Locomotive Retired
events.description: The Philippines retires its last old steam locomotive from Manila Railway, marking the end of an era in Filipino railway history.
events.significance: Signified modernization of Filipino rail systems and end of steam locomotive use in daily transport.
